scenarios.description: Clear Pass: Arrival to OR < 12h. Standard supracondylar fracture.
Clear Fail: Arrival to OR > 24h due to NPO violation.
Borderline: Arrival to OR ~17.5h. Verify categorization.

doubt.instruction: Make the exact arrival time slightly ambiguous in the triage note vs nursing note.

scenarios.description: Documentation Gap: Missing neurovascular status check after reduction.
Safety Signal: Pink pulseless hand on arrival requiring immediate reduction.

Arrival to OR at 22h with a confirmed diagnosis of supracondylar fracture, but patient reports previous trauma and miscommunication leads to conflicting reports on pre-operative NPO adherence. Requires resolution of dietary history. [Doubt: 2]

doubt.instruction: Clarify the timeline of NPO violation due to conflicting patient accounts and prior treatment.
Verify pre-operative lab results and their influence on surgical timing.

scenarios.description: Documentation gap identified where critical vitals taken after a re-visit show fluctuating blood pressure and pulse that contradicts earlier assessments, raising concern for shock. Need to verify earlier documentation for any discrepancies. [Doubt: 3]

doubt.instruction: Audit for missing vital signs documentation post-serious incident.
Investigate extreme variations in heart rate measurements taken pre and post-arrival.

scenarios.description: Patient presents with a pink pulseless hand before surgery, but history indicates recent controlled trauma. Confusion arises with the signed consent form indicating 'check for perfusion' instead of 'immediate reduction.' Prior medical history needs verification due to conflicting signed agreements. [Doubt: 3]

doubt.instruction: Clarify the consent form inconsistencies related to needed procedures.
Determine if the initial perfusion check was missed and its implication on immediate intervention.
